Banner.Description: With a four-year background in DevOps,I have actively contributed to the development of systems, interfaces, bots, and technological solutions, aiming to enhance the web landscape. My commitment extends to crafting and refactoring clean, reusable, and scalable code using Angular and occasionally Laravel, while leveraging various DevOps tools. This approach ensures adherence to industry best practices and development standards, contributing to a more efficient and robust software ecosystem.
AboutMe.Title: About me
AboutMe.Paragraphs: In my 4 years as a devops engineer, I seek to train every day. I have worked Creating pipelines Bamboo, performing continuous integration, and covering backend developer roles with Laravel and Mysql. I have led teams having empathy, exercising motivation to partners, and setting plans and goals together.
My skills also include implementing system improvements, optimizing sites, standardizing patterns, and suggesting and executing ideas that add value to the project I'm working on.
Some of the technologies that I have trained and worked on include (but are not limited to):
Experience.Title: Experience

Experience.Jobs.Title: AMERICAN EAGLE (AEO) - Senior DevOps Engineer
Description: Monitored automated build and continuous software integration process to drive build/release failure resolution.
Worked with cross-function al design teams to create software solutions that improved overall functionality and performance.
Supervised software life cycle from preliminary needs analysis to enterprise-wide deployment and support.

Creation and maintenance of a second Monitoring Platform Done in Angular, Angular Material, Laravel, Mysql, RxJS, Sass with graphics (configurable), alarm system, and user management and configuration of general parameters.
Implemented best practices to protect data and assets
Automated and implemented system backup and recovery procedures.
I built more than 150 services from scratch and deployed them in the GKE. We deployed the service in gke for K8 manifest using the helmchart

FeatureProjects.Title: My projects
FeatureProjects.Label: Featured Project

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Hands game
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: The rock-paper-scissors game extended. A personal project developed in angular in which you play randomly against the machine. It has the use of services, interfaces, and components.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Countries viewer
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: An interface that consumes an API of countries with which you can view a list of countries, see details of each country, filter by name and region. It also has a dark mode to switch between dark and light themes.

OtherProjects.Title: More projects

OtherProjects.Projects.Title: Hands game
OtherProjects.Projects.Description: The rock-paper-scissors game extended. A personal project developed in angular in which you play randomly against the machine. It has the use of services, interfaces, and components.

OtherProjects.Projects.Title: Countries viewer
OtherProjects.Projects.Description: An interface that consumes an API of countries with which you can view a list of countries, see details of each country, filter by name and region. It also has a dark mode to switch between dark and light themes.

OtherProjects.Projects.Title: Apple Music Embeddable Web Player Widget
OtherProjects.Projects.Description: Embeddable web player widget for Apple Music that lets users log in and listen to full song playback in the browser leveraging MusicKit.js. Read more about this project on 9to5Mac.

Contact.Title: Get in touch!
Contact.Content: I will be happy to receive your contact if you want to talk about new opportunities. Write me, and I will reply as soon as I see your message. Simple one-page design that features a profile letter with basic information about a person.
